comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/8283769518/in/pho... - similar pic Source re Frank Litchfield - www.youtube.com/watch?v=JPQ7CzVHdMs ; I'm pretty sure this is him, but if I'm mistaken please post a comment. Litchfield was a NSW Works Dept Harbour Bridge engineer. I'm not yet sure, but I suspect the chap between Ennis and Litchfield is Charles/Clarence Hipwell (supervisor of steelwork erection for Dorman Long & Co)

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Found them! Sources re names via this NSW Transport RMS version - trove.nla.gov.au/work/168706425?q=bradfield%3B+ennis%3B+l... ; verified via this PHM pic of the NSW PWD Harbour Bridge staff (here Butler is wearing spectacles...but the ears match up in both pics) www.powerhousemuseum.com/collection/database/?irn=389453 ; also verified via this 1932 SMH pic of the Dorman Long & Co staff nla.gov.au/nla.news-page1157143 Still to establish Hipwell's given name...at ca. 33:10 on the vid (link above) Litchfield appears to refer to him as 'Charles Hipwell'.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The NSW Transport RMS version has the date 2/5/1927 and the caption 'View of the southwestern main bearing completely assembled and in correct position, surmounted by the forged steel saddle on which the lower chord rests, attached by bolts. The bolt holes can be seen in each of the four fins of the saddle.'
